page.title: 10BULB-GROWING IN SCAMBLESBY
page.content: No bulbs are grown commercially in the wolds,but we grow Tulips and Daff- odils (2 Hectares & 5 Hectares) as an intensive crop to assist cash-flow. This takes about 10% of our acreage. More fertiliser is used to the ammount used in the Spalding area,and we use irrigation in dry seasons. {Bulbs are planted in 30 inch rows}with a potato planter.{Daffs }are left down for 2 seasons & {Tulips }for 1. They go to about 10 markets around the country,incl.London,Bristol & Liv- erpool.About 20 people are required to pick & the same for lifting & grading bulbs (July/August).{Herbicides}are used pre-emergence,and about 5 times during growing period with fungicides to control disease.{Tulips}are lifted by machine but need gentle treatment. {Daffs}are lifted by potato harvester. DAFFS:{Â£275}/TON: TULIPS{Â£22}per 1000.
